intro: Ptyssiglottis hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy ptyssiglottis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to parts of Asia and is often found in moist, shady habitats. Ptyssiglottis hirsuta is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
